content.description: Algorithm, knapsack problem (2017 Spring, Final, Question 6)

p.line: Recall the knapsack problem involves calculating the most money you can carry in a weight-limited knapsack, given boxes of different values and weights (you may choose as many boxes of the same kind as you wish). You are given a bag that holds _BOLDS_20lbs_BOLDE_ and three boxes: _BOLDS_A=$15@15lbs, B=$5@6lbs, C=$6@7lbs._BOLDE_ How much better does the _EMPHS_optimal_EMPHE_ solution do over the _EMPHS_greedy_EMPHE_ solution? (select ONE)

content.hint: Greedy soluction always takes the one with the highest score ( = value / weight), while optimal solution consider other possibilities as well.
